intro: Thymocarpus, commonly known as the desert milkweed, is a genus of flowering plants native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, showy flowers and compound leaves. The plant produces pods that contain seeds with a tuft of hair, aiding in wind dispersal. Thymocarpus species are typically shrubs or subshrubs, adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water. These plants play a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for desert wildlife.
